page.title: 03Study Area (Overview) cont
page.content: The Study Area can be subdivided into{three}broad Functional Zones. {(1)}To the East - the Airport and Kirkhill Industrial Estate. {(2)}A broad band of Mixed Farming of which the Rowett and Craibstone Agricultural and Research Institutes form a significant part. {(3)}The Western-most Zone of Commission-owned Kirkhill Forest which also incorporates a number of Forest Walks. Administratively this area coincides with a sector of the Green Belt surrounding the City of Aberdeen. In common with most Rurban fringes of British cities it has come under increasing pressure from Centrifugal Urban pressures produced largely as the result of North Sea Oil developments throughout the previous decade.
